category: Best Actor in a Leading Role

nominations.notes: Paul Newman was not present at the awards ceremony. Robert Wise accepted the award on his behalf.

category: Best Actor in a Supporting Role

nominations.notes: Co-presenter Sigourney Weaver accepted the award on Caine's behalf, as he could not attend the ceremony due to production on Jaws: The Revenge (1987). Caine later said of the poorly-received third sequel to Jaws (1975), "I have never seen it, but by all accounts it is terrible. However, I have seen the house that it built, and it is terrific."

category: Best Actress in a Leading Role

nominations.notes: Marlee Matlin became the first deaf actress to win an Oscar.

category: Best Actress in a Supporting Role

primary.name: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home

nominations.notes: Tied with Down and Out in America (1986).

primary.name: Artie Shaw: Time Is All You've Got

nominations.notes: Tied with Artie Shaw: Time Is All You've Got (1985).

category: Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium

nominations.notes: Ruth Prawer Jhabvala was not present at the awards ceremony. James Ivory accepted the award on her behalf.

category: Best Writing, Screenplay Written Directly for the Screen

nominations.notes: Woody Allen was not present at the awards ceremony. Presenter Shirley MacLaine accepted the award on his behalf.
